data: Lindfield Primary School French and Spanish Project

Project Aims - To introduce French teaching in KS2 in line with new requirements. To promote linguistic confidence among staff to facilitate effective French teaching in KS2 and Spanish teaching in KS1and EY

Objective - to increase vocabulary, confidence and competencies of staff.
                      to increase an awareness of methodologies
                      to initiate a sustained and meaningful link with a partner school

Summer term- whole school French staff meeting with support of local secondary school.

First year - MFL coordinator and 3 teachers to attend an intensive language and methodology course in France, and visit a primary school in France with a view to full immersion in school life and establishing a regular and meaningful link with our pupils.

End of first year carry out a pupil and staff questionnaire to see the impact from the first year.

Second year - 3 teachers from KS2 to attend  an intensive language and methodology course in France, to enable our parallel teachers to increase their vocabulary and French skills and to introduce them to our partner school.

2 teachers to attend an intensive language and methodology course in Spain and spend time in a Spanish Primary school.

End of second year - carry out Europass and evaluate next steps for future to ensure progression and succession and embedded quality first teaching.
THE ROYAL COMMONWEALTH SOCIETY FORTHE BLIND ROYAL CHARTER*SIGHTSAVERS INTERNATIONAL
